title: [Large-Scale] Epistemological Definition and Learning Design Framework for Open Educational Practices

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level math knowledge and experience using digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Exploring methods to apply mathematical thinking to open educational environments for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of epistemological definitions in open educational environments (OEP).

Learners conduct fair knowledge-sharing activities over 3 weeks in a 3-member collaborative problem-solving project, meeting three criteria: documenting ≥5 role assignments using Google Jamboard or Padlet, sharing ideas ≥10 times per team, and achieving ≥70% feedback implementation.

Learners apply the ADDIE framework (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation) to select three mathematical concepts (statistics/geometry/calculus), develop one educational resource (worksheet or PPT ≥10 pages) reflecting each concept’s social context (historical background or ≥2 real-world applications), and submit a final output scoring ≥4 points (5-point scale) in ≥4 categories of a peer evaluation rubric (content accuracy, contextual relevance, creativity, visual effectiveness, educational efficacy).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
